topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 1.1: Enabling and Disabling Networks

body.p: A network is a pluggable, scalable and API-driven system for managing networks and IP addresses. You can enable or disable networks, as needed.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Networks tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Network panel, then the Networks tab.
The available network(s) appear.
For the network to enable or disable, click Edit Network.
In the Edit Network screen, select Admin State to enable the port
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Networks tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Network panel, then the Networks tab.
The available network(s) appear.
For the network to disable, click Edit Network.
In the Edit Network screen, clear Admin State to disable the port.
